qas.question: How many military departments does the Department of Defense have?

answers.text: Chief of Staff of the Army

qas.question: At the end of 2016, how many soldiers were in the Regular Army?
How many soldiers were there in the entire U.S. Army at the end of 2016?
How many military departments does the Department of Agriculture have?

plausible_answers.text: Chief of Staff of the Army

qas.question: At the end of 2016,how many women were in the Regular Army?
How many women soldiers were there in the entire U.S. Army at the end of 2016?

context: As a uniformed military service, the Army is part of the Department of the Army, which is one of the <a0_0><b5_0>three<a0_0/> military departments<b5_0/> of the Department of Defense. The U.S. Army is headed by a civilian senior appointed civil servant, the <a1_0><b6_0>Secretary of the Army<b6_0/><a1_0/> (SECARMY), and by a chief military officer, the <a2_0><b7_0>Chief of Staff of the Army<b7_0/><a2_0/> (CSA) who is also a member of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. In the fiscal year 2016, the projected end strength for the Regular Army (USA) was <a3_0><b8_0>475,000<b8_0/><a3_0/> soldiers; the Army National Guard (ARNG) had 342,000 soldiers, and the United States Army Reserve (USAR) had 198,000 soldiers; the combined-component strength of the U.S. Army was <a4_0><b9_0>1,015,000<b9_0/><a4_0/> soldiers. As a branch of the armed forces, the mission of the U.S. Army is "to fight and win our Nation's wars, by providing prompt, sustained, land dominance, across the full range of military operations and the spectrum of conflict, in support of combatant commanders." The service participates in conflicts worldwide and is the major ground-based offensive and defensive force.
